context.p: A User Role defines the authorisation level or the operations a user can perform. Each User must have an associated Role.

ol.li: User: The default user-role. Is assigned on initial login to the CM portal, further User role authorisation must be assigned by request from CM portal Admin user.
Admin: In addition to 'user' privileges, Admins can manage Users and perform all primary administrative tasks.
Super-Admin: In addition to 'Admin' privileges, Super-Admins can perform CRUD operations on users and roles. This user-role has no restrictions.

context.p: NOTE: This is only available to Admins and Super-Admins.
Create a new User Role within the CM Portal.

info.p: Click the Roles link in the navigation bar.
Click the Create new User Role button.
Enter the details as shown below.
NOTE: Any restrictions on the fields are outlined.

ul.li: Name: Name of the User Role.
Permissions: All the Paths that this user-role can access (e.g: /test) and the actions they are allowed to perform (e.g: get, put, post, delete).

info.p: Click the Save button, the User Role will be created, and the user will be redirected back to the view page for the newly created User Role.
NOTE: User Role will not save if any fields are invalid (invalid fields are highlighted in red).

result.p: A New User Role is created in the CM Portal and can be assigned to users.
